item.title: The Disordered Systems Group Journal Club
item.description:
10 May 2023. Friedrich Huebner (KCL), Existence/uniqueness of solutions and absence of shock formation in the generalized hydrodynamics equation of the Lieb-Liniger model.

3 May 2023. Yan Fyodorov (KCL), Resonances in wave reflection from a disordered medium: nonlinear Sigma-model approach.

26 April 2023. Rosalba Garcia-Millan (Cambridge), Active matter, non-reciprocal interactions and entropy production.

24 April 2023. Alvise Bastianello (TU Münich), Sine-Gordon quantum simulators: a hydrodynamic perspective.

5 April 2023. Rafael Tapia Rojo (KCL), Probing the Stochastic Dynamics of Folding Proteins Using Single-Molecule Magnetic Tweezers.

27 March 2023. Josef Mak (KCL), Statics and Dynamics of non-Hermitian Many-Body Localization.

27 March 2023. David Lacoste (ESPCI Paris), From gambling to growing in uncertain environments.

8 March 2023. Alessandro Manacorda (University of Luxembourg), Dynamical mean-field theory of infinite-dimensional particle systems: from equilibrium to gradient descent dynamics.

6 March 2023. Chiara Paletta (Trinity College Dublin), A range three elliptic deformation of the Hubbard model.

1 March 2023. Somrita Ray (University of Edinburgh), To reset or not to reset!.

20 February 2023. Stefano Bo (KCL), Stochastic dynamics of single molecules across phase boundaries.

13 February 2023. Luke Davis (UCL), Active matter under thermodynamic control: insights from response theory.

8 February 2023. Jacopo de Nardis (CY Cergy Paris Université), Spin dynamics in isotropic spin chains, a surprising connection with drifting polymers.

25 January 2023. Nina Javerzat (SISSA), Schramm-Loewner Evolution for Rigidity Percolation.

18 January 2023. Bruno Loureiro (ENS Paris), Phase diagram of Stochastic Gradient Descent in high-dimensional two-layer neural networks.

11 January 2023. Johannes Hofmann (Gothenburg), Surprises in Fermi liquid theory: Anomalously long lifetimes in 2D systems.

14 December 2022. Benjamin Doyon (KCL), Ergodicity in many-body quantum systems II.

8 December 2022. Fabio Deelan Cunden (Bari), The semiclassical limit of a quantum Zeno dynamics.

7 December 2022. Carmen Cabrera-Arnau (Liverpool), A journey through the complexity of cities at different spatial scales.

30 November 2022. Francesco Mori (Oxford), The run-and-tumble particle: from universal properties to nonequilibrium phase transitions.

28 November 2022. Benjamin De Bruyne (Saclay), Constrained stochastic processes.

23 November 2022. Mark Crumpton (KCL), On eigenvalues and singular values of low-rank random matrices with non-negative entries.

16 November 2022. Alexandre Krajenbrink (Cambridge), The crossover from the Macroscopic Fluctuation Theory to the Kardar-Parisi-Zhang equation controls the large deviations of diffusive systems.

2 November 2022. Sarah Loos (Cambridge), About time-reversal symmetry broken fluctuations in nonequilibrium many-body systems.

26 October 2022. Izaak Neri (KCL), Thermodynamic trade-off relations involving first-passage times.

12 October 2022. Yan Fyodorov (KCL), Escaping the crowds: extreme values and outliers in rank-1 non-normal deformations of GUE/CUE.

5 October 2022. Yasser Roudi (KCL), The unbearable lightness of single neuron non-linearities in neural networks.

1 June 2022. Tony Jin (UniGe), KPZ universality, in a classical random walker under continuous measurement.

25 May 2022. Ben Doyon (KCL), Ergodicity in many-body quantum systems.

18 May 2022. Jerome Dubail (CNRS), Operator entanglement in 1D quantum systems.

11 May 2022. Jan Meimbohm (KCL), Finite-time dynamical phase transition in non-equilibrium relaxation.

13 April 2022. Leticia Cugliandolo (Sorbonne Université), Generalised Gibbs Ensemble for spherically constrained harmonic models.

6 April 2022. Carlo Campajola (University of Zurich), Modelling time-varying interactions in complex systems: the Score Driven Kinetic Ising Model.

30 March 2022. Debraj Das (University of Bristol), Lattice random walks: Stochastic resetting and heterogeneous space.

23 March 2022. Bertrand Lacroix A Chez Toine (KCL), Random landscape built by superposition of random plane waves.

9 March 2022. Giuseppe Torrisi (KCL), Uncovering the non-equilibrium stationary properties in sparse Boolean networks.

2 March 2022. Rashel Tublin (KCL), Compatibility of a System of Random Algebraic Equations. Combining the Least-Square Minimization with Statistical Mechanics Approach.

23 February 2022. Tobias Galla (University of Manchester), Stability and diversity in random ecologies: the physicists’ frustration.

21 February 2022. Francesco Coghi (Nordita), Large deviation results for random walks on networks.

16 February 2022. Michael Olesik (Jagiellonian University), Integration of features through space and time - The visual brain seen through the lens of a deep neural network.

3 November 2021. Uzy Smilansky (Weizmann institute), Time-delay distribution on quantum graphs.

27 October 2021. Mohammed Osman (KCL), Scattering in chaotic cavities and the eigenvector overlaps of rank-one perturbations of the GOE/GUE.
